question: If <katex>$Z_{1}$</katex> and <katex>$Z_{2}$</katex> are two non-zero complex numbers, then which of the following is not true?
explanation: Options 1, 2, and 3 are standard properties of complex numbers.
Option 4 states the Triangle Inequality incorrectly. The correct Triangle Inequality is <katex>$|Z_{1}+Z_{2}| \le |Z_{1}|+|Z_{2}|$</katex>.
Therefore, <katex>$|Z_{1}+Z_{2}| \ge |Z_{1}|+|Z_{2}|$</katex> is generally false (it only holds for collinear vectors in the same direction, but not as a general rule).
